docs.lead_paragraph: Under sunny skies but overshadowed by a seven-week labor strike, Barnard College held its 104th commencement for 530 seniors yesterday, with dozens of seniors standing in silent protest and wearing red armbands and stickers over slate-blue gowns in a show of support. Seven Barnard students, who had participated in a sit-in by striking clerical workers last month, were told last week that their diplomas would be withheld until disciplinary cases against them were resolved. An eighth senior was cleared of charges earlier this week, a college spokesman said yesterday.

headline.main: Barnard Ceremony Overshadowed by a Strike
